classes.name: PatientMonitoringSystem

attributes.name: systemId
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the monitoring system

attributes.name: patientId
attributes.description: Identifier for the patient assigned to the system

attributes.name: isDocked
attributes.description: Indicates if the system is connected to a docking station

attributes.name: isConnectedToPatient
attributes.description: Indicates whether sensor pods are attached to the patient

methods.name: connectToDock
methods.description: Connects the system to the docking station and LAN

methods.name: updateVitals
methods.description: Updates and displays patient vital data

methods.name: triggerAlarm
methods.description: Triggers an alarm for out-of-range vital signs

methods.name: sendDataToEMR
methods.description: Sends vital data to the EMR system

methods.name: updateSoftware
methods.description: Initiates a remote software update

methods.name: processSensorData
methods.description: Processes data acquired from sensor pods

methods.name: checkVitalRanges
methods.description: Checks if current vitals are within acceptable ranges

classes.description: Central system orchestrating patient monitoring, data processing, display updates, and external communication

classes.name: Pod

attributes.name: podId
attributes.description: Unique identifier for the sensor pod

attributes.name: isConnected
attributes.description: Indicates if the pod is currently connected

attributes.name: connectionType
attributes.description: Physical connector type for the pod

methods.name: collectData
methods.description: Collects vital data from the patient's sensor

methods.name: transferData
methods.description: Transfers collected data to the monitoring system

classes.description: Sensor device that collects patient vital data

classes.name: VitalData

attributes.name: timestamp
attributes.description: Time when the measurement was taken

classes.description: Container for patient vital measurements, capturing various parameters

classes.name: VitalRange

attributes.name: vitalType
attributes.description: The type of vital sign this range applies to

methods.name: isInRange
methods.description: Checks if a value is within the acceptable range

classes.description: Defines acceptable ranges for specific vital sign measurements

classes.name: Display

attributes.name: colorSettings
attributes.description: Color mapping for different vital signs

methods.name: showHistoricalData
methods.description: Shows historical vital data for the given period

methods.name: showAlarm
methods.description: Displays an alarm message on screen

classes.description: Manages the LCD display for visualizing patient vital data and alarms

classes.name: Battery

attributes.name: estimatedTimeRemaining

methods.name: startCharging

methods.name: stopCharging

methods.name: chargeBattery

methods.name: cacheData

methods.name: getCachedData

classes.description: Manages local storage and caching of patient vital data

methods.name: silence

methods.name: sendUpdate

methods.name: validateConnection

classes.description: Facilitates integration with external electronic medical record systems

methods.name: updateSoftware

classes.description: Enables remote management of software updates and system restarts

relationships.description: System comprises multiple sensor pods for vital monitoring
System includes one display for vital visualization
System uses a battery for power management
System integrates a network interface for LAN connectivity
System contains a data storage component for local caching
System includes an alarm for critical alerts
System interfaces with an external EMR system
System embeds a software controller for remote updates and restarts
Configuration includes acceptable ranges for various vital signs
System can connect to a dock for additional network and charging capabilities
Data storage archives patient vital data

domain_model.plantuml:
@startuml

class PatientMonitoringSystem {
  - systemId: String
  - patientId: String
  - language: String
  - isDocked: Boolean
  - isConnectedToPatient: Boolean
  + connectToDock(): boolean
  + updateVitals(vitals: VitalData): void
  + triggerAlarm(vitalType: String): void
  + sendDataToEMR(vitals: VitalData): void
  + updateSoftware(): void
  + processSensorData(): void
  + checkVitalRanges(): Boolean
}

class Pod {
  - podId: String
  - podType: String
  - isConnected: boolean
  - connectionType: String
  + collectData(): VitalData
  + transferData(): boolean
}

class VitalData {
  - timestamp: DateTime
  - heartRate: int
  - bloodPressure: String
  - oxygenSaturation: int
  - respirationRate: int
  - ecgData: String
  - value: float
  - vitalType: String
  - patientId: String
}

class VitalRange {
  - vitalType: String
  - minValue: float
  - maxValue: float
  + isInRange(value: float): boolean
}

class Display {
  - displayMode: String
  - colorSettings: Map<String, String>
  + showVitals(vitals: VitalData): void
  + showHistoricalData(hours: int): void
  + showAlarm(message: String): void
}

class Battery {
  - level: float
  - isCharging: Boolean
  - estimatedTimeRemaining: int
  + startCharging(): void
  + stopCharging(): void
}

class NetworkInterface {
  - connectionStatus: String
  - ipAddress: String
  - connectionSpeed: int
  + connect(): boolean
  + disconnect(): void
  + sendData(data: Object): boolean
}

class Dock {
  - ethernetSpeed: int
  - isCharging: Boolean
  + provideNetwork(): void
  + chargeBattery(): void
}

class DataStorage {
  - capacity: long
  - usedSpace: long
  - timeSpan: String
  + storeVitalData(data: VitalData): boolean
  + retrieveHistoricalData(hours: int): List<VitalData>
  + purgeOldData(olderThanHours: int): int
  + cacheData(vital: VitalData): void
  + getCachedData(): List<VitalData>
}

class Alarm {
  - isActive: boolean
  - volume: int
  + trigger(): void
  + silence(): void
}

class EMRInterface {
  - emrType: String
  - isConnected: boolean
  - lastSyncTime: DateTime
  + sendUpdate(vitals: VitalData): boolean
  + validateConnection(): boolean
}

class SoftwareController {
  - remoteCommandsAllowed: boolean
  + updateSoftware(): void
  + restartSystem(): void
}

class HospitalConfiguration {
  - language: String
  + setLanguage(lang: String): void
  + updateVitalRange(range: VitalRange): void
}

PatientMonitoringSystem "1" *-- "1..*" Pod : "composed of"
PatientMonitoringSystem "1" *-- "1" Display : "includes"
PatientMonitoringSystem "1" *-- "1" Battery : "powered by"
PatientMonitoringSystem "1" *-- "1" NetworkInterface : "connects via"
PatientMonitoringSystem "1" *-- "1" DataStorage : "stores data in"
PatientMonitoringSystem "1" *-- "1" Alarm : "triggers"
PatientMonitoringSystem "1" *-- "1" EMRInterface : "interfaces with"
PatientMonitoringSystem "1" *-- "1" SoftwareController : "managed by"
PatientMonitoringSystem "1" o-- "1" HospitalConfiguration : "aggregates"
HospitalConfiguration "1" *-- "0..*" VitalRange : "configures"
PatientMonitoringSystem "1" --> "0..1" Dock : "can dock with"
Pod "1" --> "0..*" VitalData : "generates"
DataStorage "1" --> "0..*" VitalData : "archives"
Display "1" --> "0..*" VitalData : "renders"

@enduml

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall connect to the hospital LAN via an Ethernet connection when attached to the dock.

issues.description: The condition 'when attached to the dock' is not clearly defined in terms of system state detection.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the criteria or mechanism (e.g., referencing an 'isDocked' attribute) to determine docked status.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall have an LCD that displays numerical values derived from the data acquired at the analog outputs received from the pods.

issues.description: The term 'analog outputs' is ambiguous and is not represented in the domain model; it is unclear if an ADC is required.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify whether pods output analog signals requiring conversion or digital data, and update the model accordingly.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall allow pods to transfer vital data back to the PMS through 14-Pin connectors.

issues.description: The domain model's Pod class lacks specific details for 14-Pin connectors and the requirement uses the acronym 'PMS' instead of 'PatientMonitoringSystem'.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the Pod class to include 14-Pin connector details and replace 'PMS' with 'PatientMonitoringSystem' for consistency.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: Port requirements for sensor pods: the system shall have ports for pods that record pulse, pressure, oximeter readings, and telemetry leads.

issues.description: The term 'port' is ambiguous and the Pod class does not explicitly capture sensor interface details or differentiate port types.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify whether 'port' refers to a physical connector or logical interface and update the Pod class to include pod type differentiation and explicit port attributes.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall display respiratory wave form.

issues.description: The Display class does not explicitly support waveform rendering required by this requirement.
issues.suggested_fix: Extend the Display class with a dedicated method for waveform rendering (e.g., showWaveform).

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall display 02 saturation wave form.

issues.description: The term '02 saturation' appears to be a typo and should be 'O2 saturation'; additionally, waveform rendering is not supported.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the text to 'O2 saturation' and add dedicated waveform support in the Display class.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall display ECG.

issues.description: It is unclear whether ECG should be shown as numerical values or as a waveform.
issues.suggested_fix: Specify the intended display format for ECG and update the Display class accordingly.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The LCD screen shall show the heart rate in a green color (using hexadecimal color code: #00FFOO).

issues.description: The hexadecimal color code '#00FFOO' is invalid due to the use of 'O' instead of the digit '0'.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the hex code to '#00FF00'.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The LCD screen shall show O2 Saturation in a yellow color (using hexadecimal color code: #FFFF0O).

issues.description: The hexadecimal color code '#FFFF0O' is invalid; it uses 'O' in place of '0'.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the hex code to '#FFFF00'.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The LCD shall show the respiratory wave form in a teal color (using hexadecimal color code: #008080).

issues.description: There is potential confusion between displaying numerical values and rendering a waveform; the domain model does not support dedicated waveform rendering.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the intended display format and enhance the Display class to support waveform visualization.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The LCD screen shall show O2 Saturation waveform in a yellow color (using hexadecimal color code: #FFFF00).

issues.description: While the hex code is correct, the requirement for waveform display is not reflected in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Extend the Display class to include dedicated waveform visualization capabilities.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The LCD screen shall show the EGG strip in a green color (using hexadecimal color code: #00FFOO).

issues.description: The term 'EGG' is likely a typo for 'ECG', and the hex code '#00FFOO' is invalid.
issues.suggested_fix: Correct the text to 'ECG strip' and update the hex code to '#00FF00'.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The LCD shall show the vitals record in a table format.

issues.description: The Display class does not specify support for a table format view.
issues.suggested_fix: Enhance the Display class (e.g., add a displayMode attribute) to support table view rendering.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall allow for Hospital IT professionals to remotely update the system's software when it is plugged into the dock.

issues.description: The remote update functionality is conditional on the docked status, but the domain model does not account for this state.
issues.suggested_fix: Integrate a mechanism to check the docked status (e.g., isDocked attribute) in SoftwareController before processing updates.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall store locally the last 24 hours of data received from pods (sensors).

issues.description: It is unclear if data older than 24 hours should be purged automatically and how the 24-hour retention period is enforced.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the data retention policy and update the DataStorage component to automatically purge data older than 24 hours.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall allow hospital to choose the language to display in, with the default being English.

issues.description: The domain model does not specify default language settings or a list of supported languages.
issues.suggested_fix: Define the default language and supported language options within the system configuration (e.g., in HospitalConfiguration).

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall have Spanish and French as additional language options.

issues.description: Supported languages are not explicitly modeled in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Expand the language configuration to include Spanish and French as options.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall have a two-hour battery life.

issues.description: The Battery class does not specify parameters or constraints (such as totalCapacity) to guarantee a two-hour battery life.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a 'totalCapacity' attribute or appropriate validation logic to the Battery class to meet the two-hour requirement.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: In one-minute intervals, the system shall send record updates to the Patient Records System database for heart rate, blood pressure, respiration rate, and ECG.

issues.description: The domain model does not capture any scheduling or timing mechanisms for these periodic updates, nor does it differentiate data types.
issues.suggested_fix: Integrate scheduling/timing logic within EMRInterface or PatientMonitoringSystem and specify update details for each vital sign.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall be compatible with Epic EMR.

issues.description: The EMRInterface does not explicitly include support for Epic EMR compatibility.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the EMRInterface to include Epic as a supported EMR type.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The patient-monitoring system shall share the vitals to the Central Patient-monitoring System through the hospital's LAN.

issues.description: The domain model does not include a component to represent the Central Patient-monitoring System as mentioned in the requirement.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a CentralMonitoringSystem (or CentralPatientMonitoringSystem) class with appropriate attributes and relationships.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall receive software updates through the hospital's LAN.

issues.description: The update mechanism via LAN is not detailed in the domain model, making it unclear how updates are received.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify whether updates are received via the NetworkInterface or Dock and update the SoftwareController accordingly.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall not receive software updates when connected to a patient.

issues.description: The domain model lacks a mechanism to prevent software updates when the system is connected to a patient.
issues.suggested_fix: Add a check in SoftwareController to verify the patient connection status before performing updates.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The software shall run on a Linux operating system.

issues.description: This non-functional requirement is not represented in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Document the operating system requirement in technical specifications outside the domain model.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The patient-monitoring system's ethernet connection shall be capable of 100 Mbps while connected to the dock.

issues.description: The domain model does not capture performance constraints, such as network throughput, required to ensure a 100 Mbps connection.
issues.suggested_fix: Include performance attributes or constraints in the Dock (or related association) to enforce the 100 Mbps requirement.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall continue processing health data from pods (sensors) even when it is disconnected from the dock.

issues.description: The behavior for processing data when disconnected from the dock is not defined in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify and document system behavior for both docked and undocked modes.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall come with documentation containing: Battery pack guide to demonstrate how to install and charge the battery.

issues.description: Documentation requirements are non-functional and not represented in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Capture documentation requirements in separate project artifacts.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall come with documentation containing: Hardware configuration guide.

issues.description: Documentation requirements are non-functional and not included in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Document hardware configuration guide requirements separately from the domain model.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall come with a user guide containing the following sections: How to setup the system during patient admission.

issues.description: User guide requirements are not captured within the system domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Maintain user guide specifications in separate documentation.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall come with a user guide containing the following sections: How to use the system to monitor patient vitals after admission.

issues.description: User guide content is not represented in the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Record user documentation requirements separately from the functional model.

requirement_issues.requirement_text: The system shall come with a user guide containing the following sections: How to use the system when transporting the patient.

issues.description: User guide documentation is outside the scope of the domain model.
issues.suggested_fix: Capture and manage user guide requirements in separate documentation artifacts.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement specifies that each Patient Monitoring System device must have a unique system identifier.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall assign and display a unique system identifier (systemId) for each Patient Monitoring System at startup and include it in status reports and logs.
missing_requirements.rationale: A unique systemId is essential for device tracking, maintenance, auditing, and integration within a hospital environment.

missing_requirements.description: No explicit requirement for sensor pods to autonomously collect and transfer vital data.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: Each sensor pod shall continuously collect vital data at predefined intervals using its collectData() method and immediately transfer the data to the Patient Monitoring System via its transferData() operation.
missing_requirements.rationale: Automated data collection ensures uninterrupted real-time monitoring and data integrity.

missing_requirements.description: VitalData records are not required to be timestamped.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall assign a precise timestamp to every vital data measurement using the VitalData.timestamp attribute when the measurement is recorded.
missing_requirements.rationale: Accurate timestamps are necessary for tracking patient conditions, correlating data with clinical events, and supporting historical analysis.

missing_requirements.description: No explicit mechanism to purge vital data records older than the 24-hour retention period.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall automatically purge or remove vital data records older than 24 hours from local storage to ensure optimal data storage utilization.
missing_requirements.rationale: Automated data purging maintains storage efficiency and ensures that only relevant recent data is retained.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement mandates that hospital personnel must be able to manually silence an active alarm.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall provide an interface that allows authorized hospital personnel to manually silence an active alarm via the Alarm.silence() method and log the silencing event.
missing_requirements.rationale: Manual silencing helps manage nuisance alarms and ensures real emergencies receive prompt attention while maintaining an audit trail.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement specifies a mechanism for low battery alerts with escalation.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall trigger a visual and audible alert when the battery level falls below 20%, with escalating alerts at 10% and 5% remaining capacity.
missing_requirements.rationale: Timely battery alerts with escalation are critical to prevent unexpected shutdowns and ensure uninterrupted patient monitoring.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for emergency power mode when battery is critically low.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall enter emergency power mode when battery level falls below 10%, disabling non-critical functions to extend monitoring capabilities.
missing_requirements.rationale: Emergency power mode is necessary to maintain essential system functions during critical battery depletion.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement ensures the system automatically reconnects to the hospital LAN after a dropped connection.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall continuously monitor the network connection status and automatically attempt reconnection using the appropriate method if the connection is lost.
missing_requirements.rationale: Automatic reconnection is vital for maintaining continuous data transmission and integration with critical external systems.

missing_requirements.description: No explicit requirement for monitoring and validating continuous connectivity with the external EMR.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall periodically validate its connection with the external EMR using the EMRInterface.validateConnection() method and alert hospital IT personnel if the connection is lost, switching to offline caching if needed.
missing_requirements.rationale: Ensuring continuous EMR connectivity is critical for data integration and timely patient record updates.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement ensures that remote commands for software updates and system restarts are authenticated.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall enforce strong authentication, including multi-factor authentication, for any remote commands executed for software updates or system restarts.
missing_requirements.rationale: Robust authentication is essential to prevent unauthorized remote access and safeguard system integrity.

missing_requirements.description: No explicit requirement for logging critical system events and maintaining an audit trail.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall log all critical events—including remote updates, system restarts, alarm triggers, configuration changes, and network connectivity changes—and maintain an encrypted audit trail for a minimum of 90 days.
missing_requirements.rationale: Comprehensive logging is essential for troubleshooting, auditability, regulatory compliance, and ensuring patient safety.

missing_requirements.description: No performance requirement defines the maximum acceptable latency for updating the vital signs display.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall process and display new vital sign data on the LCD within 1 second of receiving data from sensor pods.
missing_requirements.rationale: Timely updates are critical for real-time monitoring and prompt clinical decision-making.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement mandates that all data transmissions over the network be encrypted.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall encrypt all patient data transmitted over the network using AES-256 or equivalent encryption to comply with HIPAA and cybersecurity standards.
missing_requirements.rationale: Encrypting data in transit is vital for protecting patient privacy and ensuring data security.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for pod connection status monitoring.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall display a persistent visual indicator for each pod's connection status (connected/disconnected).
missing_requirements.rationale: Monitoring pod connectivity is critical to ensure all sensors are properly connected and functioning.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for alarm escalation.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall escalate alarm volume by 10% every 30 seconds if an active alarm is not acknowledged.
missing_requirements.rationale: Escalating alarms ensure that critical alerts receive attention in busy hospital environments.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for an automatic system self-test upon startup.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall perform an automatic self-test of all components upon startup and report any failures to the display.
missing_requirements.rationale: Self-tests ensure system reliability and readiness before patient monitoring begins.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for data backup during power loss.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall automatically back up all unsent patient data to non-volatile storage when a power loss is detected.
missing_requirements.rationale: Automatic backup prevents data loss during unexpected power outages.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for multi-patient support.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall support storing configuration for up to 5 patients to facilitate rapid patient transitions.
missing_requirements.rationale: Supporting multiple patient configurations improves workflow efficiency in high-turnover environments.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for network failover handling.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall queue and automatically retry failed EMR transmissions when network connectivity is restored.
missing_requirements.rationale: Ensuring data is eventually transmitted despite temporary network issues is crucial for system reliability.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for user authentication for configuration changes.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall require biometric authentication before allowing configuration changes to vital sign ranges or alarm settings.
missing_requirements.rationale: Strong authentication prevents unauthorized changes to critical monitoring parameters.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for validating incoming sensor data for physiological plausibility.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall validate all incoming sensor data to ensure it falls within plausible physiological ranges before processing or display.
missing_requirements.rationale: Data validation helps prevent erroneous data from leading to clinical errors.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for display timeout to save power.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The display shall dim after 2 minutes of inactivity and turn off after 5 minutes, reactivating upon user touch or an alarm.
missing_requirements.rationale: A display timeout feature improves battery life while maintaining accessibility.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for explicit alarm acknowledgement.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall require explicit user acknowledgement of all alarms, recording the time and user identifier for each acknowledgement.
missing_requirements.rationale: Explicit alarm acknowledgement ensures accountability and creates an audit trail for alarm responses.

missing_requirements.description: Missing requirement for a patient transfer protocol.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall provide a dedicated 'patient transfer' mode that temporarily suspends non-critical alerts during patient transport.
missing_requirements.rationale: A patient transfer mode helps manage alerts during patient movement, reducing distractions.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement specifies how the system handles patient disconnection or pod detachment.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall detect when sensor pods are disconnected from a patient and provide a visual and audible notification to healthcare staff.
missing_requirements.rationale: Handling disconnections promptly is critical for patient safety in case of sensor detachment.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement specifies system authentication and access control.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall require authenticated access with unique user credentials and role-based access controls for viewing patient data, changing configurations, and performing administrative functions.
missing_requirements.rationale: Authentication and access control are essential to maintain patient data security and privacy.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for data backup and recovery.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall automatically back up all patient data to secure storage when connected to the dock and provide a recovery mechanism to restore data in case of system failure.
missing_requirements.rationale: Data backup and recovery are critical for data integrity and continuity of care.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for system initialization and patient assignment.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall provide a patient assignment workflow allowing healthcare staff to associate the monitoring system with a specific patient ID at startup, including verification steps to prevent misidentification.
missing_requirements.rationale: Proper patient assignment is essential for accurate attribution of monitoring data.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for handling network connection failures.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall queue EMR updates locally when network connectivity is lost and automatically synchronize data when the connection is restored, with visual indicators of connection status.
missing_requirements.rationale: Managing network failures ensures data consistency and system reliability in unstable network conditions.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for system performance under load.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall maintain a data processing latency of less than 250 milliseconds when processing inputs from all connected sensor pods simultaneously.
missing_requirements.rationale: Performance under load is critical to ensure real-time monitoring and responsive system behavior.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for handling sensor pod malfunctions.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall detect sensor pod malfunctions within 5 seconds and provide distinct visual and audible notifications differentiating between disconnection and malfunction events.
missing_requirements.rationale: Detecting malfunctions promptly is essential to avoid false readings and ensure accurate patient monitoring.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for silencing alarms with a defined timeout.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall allow authorized healthcare personnel to temporarily silence alarms for a configurable period (1-10 minutes) with a visual indication and automatic reactivation after the period expires.
missing_requirements.rationale: Clear silencing mechanisms help manage multiple alarms while ensuring that critical alerts are not permanently ignored.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for concurrent monitoring of multiple vital signs.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall be capable of simultaneously monitoring and displaying data from all connected vital sign pods with a refresh rate of at least once per second.
missing_requirements.rationale: Concurrent monitoring is a fundamental capability for real-time multi-parameter patient monitoring.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for system self-diagnostics.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall perform automated self-diagnostic tests at startup and every 24 hours during operation, checking all critical components and reporting issues through the display interface.
missing_requirements.rationale: Self-diagnostics contribute to system reliability by proactively detecting problems before they impact patient care.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for battery replacement notification.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall notify hospital IT staff when battery health falls below 70% of its original capacity to provide advance warning for replacement planning.
missing_requirements.rationale: Proactive notifications about battery health ensure timely maintenance and prevent unexpected system downtime.

missing_requirements.description: No requirement for handling multiple alarm conditions simultaneously.
missing_requirements.suggested_requirement: The system shall be capable of handling and clearly displaying multiple simultaneous alarm conditions with differentiation of alarm types and severity levels.
missing_requirements.rationale: Proper management of concurrent alarms is essential in critical patient scenarios to avoid confusion and ensure prompt response.

domain_model_issues.description: The Pod class does not explicitly capture sensor interface ports and lacks differentiation of pod types (e.g., pulse, pressure, oximeter, telemetry leads) required by the requirements.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Extend the Pod class with an enumeration of pod types and add explicit attributes for port details or consider subclassing for type-specific interfaces.

domain_model_issues.description: The colorSettings attribute does not specify the specific color codes required for different vital signs as mentioned in the requirements.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Update the attribute description to include explicit color codes for each vital sign (e.g., heart rate, O2 saturation, respiratory rate).

domain_model_issues.description: The domain model does not clearly define supported languages or default language settings.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Specify a list of supported languages and a default (e.g., English) in the appropriate configuration component.

domain_model_issues.description: The domain model does not include a component to represent the Central Patient-monitoring System mentioned in the requirements.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add a CentralMonitoringSystem class with appropriate attributes and relationships.

domain_model_issues.description: The method does not capture the one-minute interval update requirement and lacks scheduling mechanisms for periodic updates.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Enhance the method to include update frequency parameters or integrate scheduling logic.

domain_model_issues.description: The volume attribute does not enforce the required range (50-60 decibels) as specified in the requirements.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Implement validation or add constraints to ensure the volume remains within 50-60 dB.

domain_model_issues.description: The method does not check if the system is connected to a patient before performing software updates.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Integrate logic to check patient connection status prior to executing updates.

domain_model_issues.description: The attribute does not specify constraints or calculations to ensure the battery meets the two-hour life requirement.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add a 'totalCapacity' attribute or appropriate calculation logic to enforce the two-hour battery life.

domain_model_issues.description: The PatientMonitoringSystem lacks methods to handle patient connection status changes, affecting update restrictions.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add methods such as setPatientConnectionStatus(boolean) to manage connection states.

domain_model_issues.description: The Display class does not have dedicated methods for rendering waveform graphics required for respiratory and O2 saturation displays.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Introduce dedicated methods (e.g., showWaveform) or extend existing display methods to support waveform visualization.

domain_model_issues.description: Performance constraints like the 100 Mbps ethernet requirement are not captured in the domain model.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Define performance attributes or constraints for the Dock's ethernet connection to ensure 100 Mbps capability.

domain_model_issues.description: The interface does not explicitly include support for Epic EMR compatibility.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Add explicit validation or specialization to include Epic as a supported EMR type.

domain_model_issues.description: Regulatory requirements (NFPA, HIPAA, etc.) are not reflected in the domain model.
domain_model_issues.suggested_fix: Document compliance requirements in the system's technical specifications and incorporate necessary design considerations.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall connect to the hospital LAN via an Ethernet connection when attached to the dock.
missing_elements: Feedback mechanism to indicate connection status
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall connect to the hospital LAN via an Ethernet connection when attached to the dock and display a clear connection status (success/failure) to the user.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Including error handling and status feedback helps operators troubleshoot connectivity issues and ensures robust system behavior.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall have an LCD that displays numerical values derived from the data acquired at the analog outputs received from the pods.
missing_elements: Specific vital signs to be displayed
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall have an LCD screen of at least 10 inches with minimum 1280x720 resolution that displays numerical values derived from the data acquired at the analog outputs received from the pods, with a refresh rate of at least once per second.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Clarifying which values are shown and their format, including units, minimizes ambiguity during implementation and testing.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall allow pods to transfer vital data back to the PMS through 14-Pin connectors.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall allow pods to transfer vital data back to the Patient Monitoring System (PMS) via standardized 14-pin connectors using a defined communication protocol with error-checking mechanisms.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Adding technical specifics ensures clarity on connector type, data integrity, and facilitates consistent hardware implementations.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall have a port for the pod that records pulse.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall have a dedicated 14-Pin port that is clearly labeled for the pod that records pulse, ensuring compatibility with industry-standard pulse monitoring pods.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Clarifying physical and measurement details reduces implementation ambiguity and supports proper integration of the pulse-monitoring module.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall have a port for the pod that records pressure.
missing_elements: Measurement units (e.g., mmHg) for blood pressure
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall have a dedicated 14-Pin port that is clearly labeled for the pod that records pressure, ensuring compatibility with industry-standard blood pressure monitoring pods.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about port specifications and compatibility with specific pressure monitoring pods.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall have a port for the pod that records oximeter.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall have a dedicated 14-Pin port that is clearly labeled for the pod that records oximeter data, ensuring compatibility with industry-standard oxygen saturation monitoring pods.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying what is measured and how the connection is made avoids ambiguity and aligns with expected medical metrics.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall have a port for the pod that records telemetry leads.
missing_elements: Clarification on the type of telemetry (e.g., ECG signals)
Connector type and data format details
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall have a dedicated 14-Pin port that is clearly labeled for the pod that records telemetry leads, ensuring compatibility with industry-standard ECG monitoring pods.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Defining the telemetry type and hardware specifications minimizes confusion and supports accurate signal processing.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall display heart rate.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall display heart rate in beats per minute (BPM) with an update frequency of at least once per second, presenting both current value and a trend line of the past 5 minutes.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying units and display location helps ensure consistency across different system displays and enhances user interpretation.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall display blood pressure.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall display blood pressure in mmHg showing both systolic and diastolic values (e.g., 120/80 mmHg), updating at least once per minute, and presenting both current values and a trend line of the past 30 minutes.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about units of measurement, update frequency, and how the blood pressure should be displayed.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall display vitals record from the previous 24 hours.
missing_elements: Details on which vitals and how they are organized
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall display vitals records from the previous 24 hours in both tabular and graphical formats, accessible through a dedicated 'History' button, with data sampled at least once per minute.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about how users access historical data, how it's displayed, and the sampling frequency of the stored data.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall display respiratory wave form.
missing_elements: Graphical representation details (e.g., continuous update, scaling)
Specifics on update frequency and data source
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall display respiratory waveform with a minimum update frequency of 20 Hz, auto-scaling to optimize visibility, and showing at least the most recent 10 seconds of data with an option to expand to 30 seconds.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Clarifying the graphical details and update criteria increases usability and ensures adherence to real-time monitoring objectives.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall display 02 saturation wave form.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall display O2 saturation waveform with a minimum update frequency of 60 Hz, auto-scaling to optimize visibility, and showing at least the most recent 10 seconds of data with an option to expand to 30 seconds.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about waveform update frequency, scaling, and the time period displayed. Also note the typo '02' should be 'O2'.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall display ECG.
missing_elements: Graphical representation specifics (scaling, continuous update, layout)
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall display ECG waveform with a minimum update frequency of 250 Hz, supporting standard lead configurations (I, II, III, aVR, aVL, aVF, V1-V6), and showing at least the most recent 10 seconds of data with an option to expand to 60 seconds.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about ECG update frequency, supported lead configurations, and the time period displayed.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall allow hospital personnel to define the range of heart rate.
missing_elements: Method of input (e.g., user interface details)
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall allow authorized hospital personnel with administrative privileges to define the acceptable range of heart rate between 20-300 BPM, with default values set to 60-100 BPM for adult patients.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about who can define ranges, what the allowable limits are, and what default values should be used.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall allow hospital personnel to define the range of blood pressure.
missing_elements: Clarification if both systolic and diastolic pressures are required
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall allow authorized hospital personnel with administrative privileges to define the acceptable range of systolic (50-250 mmHg) and diastolic (30-150 mmHg) blood pressure, with default values set to 90-140 mmHg systolic and 60-90 mmHg diastolic for adult patients.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about who can define ranges, what the allowable limits are for both systolic and diastolic values, and what default values should be used.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall allow hospital personnel to define the range of O2 saturation.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall allow authorized hospital personnel with administrative privileges to define the acceptable range of O2 saturation between 70-100%, with a default lower threshold of 92% for adult patients.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about who can define ranges, what the allowable limits are, and what default values should be used.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall allow hospital personnel to define the range of respiration rate.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall allow authorized hospital personnel with administrative privileges to define the acceptable range of respiration rate between 4-60 breaths per minute, with default values set to 12-20 breaths per minute for adult patients.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about who can define ranges, what the allowable limits are, and what default values should be used.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall trigger alarms when the patient's vitals are outside the range that hospital personnel defined.
missing_elements: Identification of which vital signs are monitored
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall trigger both an audible alarm and a visual alert on the LCD when any monitored vital sign (e.g., heart rate, blood pressure, O2 saturation, respiration rate) falls outside the hospital-defined acceptable range.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about how quickly alarms should trigger and whether there are different priority levels for different degrees of deviation.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall not trigger alarms when the patient's vitals are within the ranges that hospital personnel defined.
missing_elements: Clarification on continuous monitoring and borderline conditions
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall refrain from triggering any audible or visual alarms when all monitored patient vital signs remain within the hospital-defined acceptable ranges, with continuous evaluation to promptly detect any deviations.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Explicitly stating continuous monitoring ensures that there is no accidental alert during normal operation.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The LCD screen shall show the heart rate in a green color (using hexadecimal color code: #00FFOO).
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The LCD screen shall show the heart rate in a green color (using hexadecimal color code: #00FF00) with a minimum font size of 18pt and bold formatting for optimal visibility.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement specifies color but lacks details about font size and text formatting. Also note there's a typo in the hex code - 'O' characters instead of '0' digits.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The LCD screen shall show O2 Saturation in a yellow color (using hexadecimal color code: #FFFF0O).
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The LCD screen shall show O2 Saturation in a yellow color (using hexadecimal color code: #FFFF00) with a minimum font size of 18pt and bold formatting for optimal visibility.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement specifies color but lacks details about font size and text formatting. Also note there's a typo in the hex code - 'O' character instead of '0' digit.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The LCD screen shall show the respiratory rate in a teal color (using hexadecimal color code: #008080).
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The LCD screen shall show the respiratory rate in a teal color (using hexadecimal color code: #008080) with a minimum font size of 18pt and bold formatting for optimal visibility.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement clearly specifies both the display parameter and the proper color code.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The LCD Shall show the respiratory wave form in a teal color (using hexadecimal color code: #008080).
missing_elements: Detailed graphical display specifications (e.g., continuous update, scaling)
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The LCD shall show the respiratory waveform in a teal color (using hexadecimal color code: #008080) with a line thickness of at least 2px and appropriate vertical scaling to maximize waveform visibility.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement specifies color but lacks details about line thickness and scaling parameters for the waveform.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The LCD screen shall show O2 Saturation waveform in a yellow color (using hexadecimal color code: #FFFF00).
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The LCD screen shall show O2 Saturation waveform in a yellow color (using hexadecimal color code: #FFFF00) with a line thickness of at least 2px and appropriate vertical scaling to maximize waveform visibility.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement specifies color but lacks details about line thickness and scaling parameters for the waveform.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The LCD screen shall show the EGG strip in a green color (using hexadecimal color code: #00FFOO).
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The LCD screen shall show the ECG strip in a green color (using hexadecimal color code: #00FF00) with a line thickness of at least 2px and appropriate vertical scaling to maximize waveform visibility.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement specifies color but lacks details about line thickness and scaling parameters for the waveform. Also note there are two typos: 'EGG' should be 'ECG' and 'O' characters instead of '0' digits in the hex code.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The LCD shall show the vitals record in a table format.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The LCD shall show the vitals record in a table format with columns for timestamp, heart rate, blood pressure, O2 saturation, and respiration rate, allowing users to sort by time and scroll through at least 24 hours of data.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about what columns should be included in the table, how many rows should be visible, and whether sorting or filtering is available.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall make an audible noise that is between 50 and 60 decibels when an alarm is triggered.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall make an audible noise that is between 50 and 60 decibels when an alarm is triggered, using distinct patterns to indicate different alarm priorities (e.g., continuous tone for high priority, intermittent for medium priority).
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement specifies volume but lacks details about the alarm pattern or tone to distinguish different alarm types.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall not make an audible noise when an alarm is not triggered.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall not make an audible noise when an alarm is not triggered.
requirement_completeness.rationale: This requirement is complete as it clearly states the negative condition - when the system should not make noise.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall allow for Hospital IT professionals to remotely update the system's software when it is plugged into the dock.
missing_elements: Authentication and security details for remote updates
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall allow for authenticated Hospital IT professionals with administrative privileges to remotely update the system's software using secure HTTPS protocol when it is plugged into the dock, with verification of update integrity before installation.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about authentication/authorization requirements and the secure protocol to be used for updates.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall allow for the Hospital IT professionals to remotely restart the system.
missing_elements: Detailed restart procedure or interface specifics
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall allow for authenticated Hospital IT professionals with administrative privileges to remotely restart the system only when the system is not actively monitoring a patient, with a notification to nearby staff before restart is initiated.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about authentication/authorization requirements, conditions when restart is allowed, and notification to clinical staff.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall store locally the last 24 hours of data received from pods (sensors).
missing_elements: Data retention policies (e.g., purge older data)
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall store locally the last 24 hours of data received from pods (sensors) at a minimum sampling rate of once per minute for numerical values and appropriate clinical sampling rates for waveforms, using an encrypted database format.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about the sampling rate for stored data and the format/security of the storage.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall allow the users to view the cached data on the LCD.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall allow authorized users to view the cached data on the LCD through a dedicated 'History' button, with options to view data in both graphical and tabular formats, and controls to navigate through different time periods within the 24-hour cache.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about how users access cached data, how it's displayed, and how users navigate through different time periods.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall allow hospital to choose the language to display in, with the default being English.
missing_elements: List of supported languages beyond the default
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall allow authorized hospital administrators to choose the language to display in through a settings menu, with the default being English, and the selected language preference shall persist across system restarts.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about who can change the language setting and whether the setting persists across system restarts.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall have Spanish and French as additional language options.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall have Spanish and French as additional language options, with 100% translation coverage for all user interface elements, error messages, and documentation.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement specifies languages but doesn't address the completeness of translation across the system.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall utilize the integrated lithium battery when it is not connected to the dock.
missing_elements: Details on the automatic switching mechanism
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall automatically switch to using the integrated lithium battery for power when not connected to the dock, ensuring uninterrupted operation.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Clarifying the switching mechanism helps guarantee that power management operates reliably in all conditions.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall have a two-hour battery life.
missing_elements: Operating conditions under which the two-hour battery life is measured
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall have a minimum two-hour battery life under normal operating conditions with all sensors connected, and shall maintain this capacity for at least 500 charge cycles or 2 years of operation.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about the conditions under which the battery life is measured and the expected battery performance over time.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall utilize battery power when there is a power-outage.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall automatically transition to battery power within 100 milliseconds when there is a power-outage, with no interruption to monitoring functions.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about how quickly the system should switch to battery power and whether there should be any interruption to functionality.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall recharge its battery when connected to external DC power via the docking station.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall recharge its battery when connected to external DC power via the docking station, reaching 80% capacity within 1 hour and full capacity within 2 hours, with visual indicators showing charging status.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about charging time expectations and how users are informed about charging status.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall continuously monitor the patient while the pods (sensors) are attached to the patient.
missing_elements: Handling of data loss or sensor disconnects
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall continuously monitor the patient while the pods (sensors) are attached to the patient, with appropriate clinical sampling rates for each vital sign and a minimum uptime guarantee of 99.9%.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about the sampling frequency for continuous monitoring and uptime expectations.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The patient-monitoring system records shall be stored in Patient Records Systems (EMR).
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The patient-monitoring system records shall be stored in Patient Records Systems (EMR) using HL7 FHIR standard format, transmitted securely using TLS encryption, with updates sent at least once every minute while a patient is being monitored.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about the data format, transmission frequency, and security requirements for EMR integration.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system in one-minute intervals, shall send record updates to the Patient Records System database of the field data for heart rate.
missing_elements: Error handling or retry mechanisms in case of failed transmission
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system in one-minute intervals, shall send record updates to the Patient Records System database of the field data for heart rate, with automatic retry mechanism if transmission fails, attempting at least 3 retries before alerting staff.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Including transmission details and error handling enhances reliability and helps meet regulatory integration standards.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system in one-minute intervals, shall send record updates to the Patient Records System database of the field data for blood pressure.
missing_elements: Communication protocol and error handling details
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system in one-minute intervals, shall send record updates to the Patient Records System database of the field data for blood pressure, with automatic retry mechanism if transmission fails, attempting at least 3 retries before alerting staff.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Specifying these elements ensures consistent and reliable data exchange with the EMR system.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system in one-minute intervals, shall send record updates to the Patient Records System database of the field data for respiration rate.
missing_elements: Data structure and protocol details for transmission
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system in one-minute intervals, shall send record updates to the Patient Records System database of the field data for respiration rate, with automatic retry mechanism if transmission fails, attempting at least 3 retries before alerting staff.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Detailing these requirements supports reliable and secure communication with external systems.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system in one-minute intervals, shall send record updates to the Patient Records System database of the field data for ECG.
missing_elements: Transmission protocol and error handling details
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system in one-minute intervals, shall send record updates to the Patient Records System database of the field data for ECG, with automatic retry mechanism if transmission fails, attempting at least 3 retries before alerting staff.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Clarifying data exchange details for ECG improves interoperability and system reliability.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall be compatible with Epic EMR.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall be compatible with Epic EMR version 2022 or newer, using HL7 FHIR R4 API for integration, and shall maintain Epic certification for interoperability.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about which versions of Epic are supported, how the integration works, and whether certification is required.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall have a unique identifier code to identify each patient.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall have a unique identifier code to identify each patient, using the hospital's standard MRN format, entered via barcode scanner or manual entry, with validation against the hospital database to ensure accuracy.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about the format of the identifier, how it's entered into the system, and how accuracy is ensured.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The patient-monitoring system shall share the vitals to the Central Patient-monitoring System through the hospital's LAN.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The patient-monitoring system shall share the vitals to the Central Patient-monitoring System through the hospital's LAN using HL7 protocol over TLS encryption, updating at least once every 5 seconds for critical vitals and once per minute for other measurements.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Adding specifics on how the data are shared ensures consistency, security, and proper system integration.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall be compliant with NFPA standards.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall be compliant with NFPA 99 (Health Care Facilities Code) and NFPA 70 (National Electrical Code) standards, as verified by UL certification or equivalent third-party testing.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about which specific NFPA standards apply and how compliance should be verified.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall be compliant with OSHA laws.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall be compliant with OSHA regulations 29 CFR 1910 Subpart S (Electrical) and 29 CFR 1910.1030 (Bloodborne Pathogens), as verified by appropriate certification and documentation.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about which specific OSHA regulations apply and how compliance should be verified.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall be compliant with HIPAA laws.
missing_elements: Implementation details for privacy and security
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall be compliant with HIPAA Privacy and Security Rules, including access controls, audit logs, encryption of PHI both at rest and in transit, and shall undergo annual third-party HIPAA compliance assessment.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about which specific HIPAA provisions apply and how compliance should be verified.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall be compliant with HIPAA Security Rule (OCR 2022).
missing_elements: Detailed security requirements (e.g., access controls, encryption, auditing)
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall be compliant with HIPAA Security Rule (OCR 2022), as verified by annual third-party security assessment and penetration testing, with documentation available for audit purposes.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement specifies the standard but lacks details about how compliance should be verified and documented.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall receive software updates through the hospital's LAN.
missing_elements: Security and authentication details for update process
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall receive authenticated and digitally signed software updates through the hospital's LAN using secure HTTPS protocol, with integrity verification before installation, and shall only apply updates during scheduled maintenance windows.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about update authentication, verification, and when updates should be applied.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall not receive software updates when connected to a patient.
missing_elements: Clarification on operational mode during active patient monitoring
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall disable or postpone software updates when it is actively connected to a patient, ensuring updates occur only when the system is not in patient monitoring mode.
requirement_completeness.rationale: This requirement is complete as it clearly states when software updates should not be received.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The software shall run on a Linux operating system.
missing_elements: Performance criteria on the target OS
Specific Linux distribution and version details
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The software shall run on a Linux operating system, specifically a medical-grade distribution of Ubuntu LTS 20.04 or newer, with security hardening according to CIS benchmarks.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about which Linux distribution/version is required and security hardening expectations.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The patient-monitoring system's ethernet connection shall be capable of 100 Mbps while connected to the dock.
missing_elements: Testing conditions and verification criteria for speed
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The patient-monitoring system's Ethernet connection shall support speeds of up to 100 Mbps when connected to the dock, verified under defined standard testing conditions.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement specifies speed but lacks details about duplex mode (half vs. full) and auto-negotiation capabilities.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall continue processing health data from pods (sensors) even when it is disconnected from the dock.
missing_elements: Performance metrics to validate continuous processing
Details on operating modes when undocked
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall maintain continuous processing of health data from attached pods, even when disconnected from the dock, by automatically switching to an alternate power or processing mode.
requirement_completeness.rationale: This requirement is complete as it clearly states that processing should continue when disconnected from the dock.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall come with documentation containing: Battery pack guide to demonstrate how to install and charge the battery.
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall come with documentation containing: Battery pack guide in both printed and digital PDF formats to demonstrate how to install and charge the battery, including troubleshooting procedures.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about the format of the documentation (print vs. digital) and whether troubleshooting is included.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall come with documentation containing: Hardware configuration guide.
missing_elements: Scope and level of detail for the hardware configuration
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall come with documentation containing: Hardware configuration guide in both printed and digital PDF formats, covering port identification, sensor connections, docking procedures, and network setup with illustrative diagrams.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about the format of the documentation and what specific hardware configuration topics should be covered.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall come with a user guide containing the following sections: How to setup the system during patient admission.
missing_elements: Format or structure details of the user guide
Additional sections to support overall system operation
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall come with a user guide in both printed and digital PDF formats containing the following sections: How to setup the system during patient admission, including step-by-step instructions with screenshots for patient identification, sensor attachment, and initial vital sign verification.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about the format of the guide and the level of detail that should be included in the setup instructions.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall come with a user guide containing the following sections: How to use the system to monitor patient vitals after admission.
missing_elements: Details on guide structure and additional usage scenarios
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall come with a user guide in both printed and digital PDF formats containing the following sections: How to use the system to monitor patient vitals after admission, including instructions for interpreting displays, adjusting alarm settings, reviewing historical data, and responding to alerts.
requirement_completeness.rationale: The requirement lacks details about the format of the guide and the specific monitoring tasks that should be covered in the instructions.

requirement_completeness.requirement_text: The system shall come with a user guide containing the following sections: How to use the system when transporting the patient.
missing_elements: Safety considerations and guide format details for transport scenarios
requirement_completeness.suggested_improvement: The system shall come with a user guide in both printed and digital PDF formats containing the following sections: How to use the system when transporting the patient, including instructions for disconnecting from the dock, battery management during transport, maintaining sensor connections, and reconnecting to the dock at the destination.
requirement_completeness.rationale: Detailing operating procedures and safety measures for patient transport increases user confidence and system reliability in dynamic environments.

reasoning.domain_model: The consensus domain model was created by merging the classes, attributes, methods, and relationships from the three source models. Similar components such as PatientMonitoringSystem, sensor pods (Pod/SensorPort), vital measurements (VitalData/VitalSign), acceptable ranges (VitalRange/VitalSignRange), display units (Display/LCDDisplay), battery management, network connectivity (NetworkInterface/EthernetAdapter), and EMR integrations were unified. Redundant concepts were merged by combining the best attributes and methods (for example, incorporating language settings and docking status into PatientMonitoringSystem, and merging display color settings and modes) while preserving key relationships like composition and aggregation. This resulted in a coherent, complete, and consistent view of the patient monitoring domain.
reasoning.analysis: The consolidated analysis integrates insights from three separate reviews. Duplicate issues were merged while unique points were preserved. Key requirement issues include incorrect hexadecimal codes, ambiguous terminology (such as 'port' and 'analog outputs'), and inconsistent use of abbreviations. Critical missing requirements span functional, security, and performance areas. Domain model issues highlight deficiencies in representing sensor ports, waveform display capabilities, language configuration, and regulatory compliance. Collectively, the analysis provides a comprehensive view for addressing inconsistencies, gaps, and integration issues between the requirements and the domain model.
